head.title: At the Corner of Shakespeare and Verdi

hedline.hl1: At the Corner of Shakespeare and Verdi

block.p: Re ''In a City Where Good Luck Meets Hope, Signs of Magic'' (Mexico City Journal, front page, Aug. 7):
Re ''In a City Where Good Luck Meets Hope, Signs of Magic'' (Mexico City Journal, front page, Aug. 7):
It was fascinating to read that the people of Mexico City hear poetry in the naming of their streets, recalling enduring writers and composers like Shakespeare, Tolstoy and Verdi.

Although the Long Island hamlet where I live is made up of far fewer streets for a population that is only a tiny fraction of the one that inhabits that great metropolis south of the border, some of us live on ways named for 19th-century American writers like Thoreau, Emerson, Whitman, Cooper and Irving.
British literati are also remembered in Scott Avenue and in Pickwick and Canterbury Lanes. In order not to slight many other renowned wordsmiths, there is also a Poet Avenue in North Babylon.
HOWARD PIERSON North Babylon, N.Y., Aug. 7, 2000
